abstract: Cable companies are developing services so people can watch pay TV on the Internet, which may open up networks that haven’t been online.
snippet: Cable companies are developing services so people can watch pay TV on the Internet, which may open up networks that haven’t been online.
lead_paragraph: There was a lot of discussion online Friday about reports that Comcast and Time Warner are preparing a way to let their customers watch their cable programs on the Internet. Most of the reports characterized this as a way for the cable companies to defend themselves against the threat of Hulu, an online video service.
